result.execSummary:
The defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges, pay all applicable fees or supervision, pay mandatory DNA surcharge; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Payment plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole. All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment. Cash bail to be applied to all monetary obligations. Any bail remaining after payment of all monetary obligations is to be returned to the person who posted.
NO POSSESSION OF A FIREARM FOR 2 YEARS
No contact with victim, Cassie K., and co-defendant, Rebecca Bray.

Comply/cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by department of corrections, probation and parole.
Civil judgment warning given.
Pay restitution in the amount of zero.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Count 1, credit for 0 days time served

records.addlTxt: Order DENYING Release Privileges, signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release for child care and/or on GPS after revocation of probation.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 06/11/14. AR
Of Right To Seek Postconviction Relief, FILED.

THIS ENTRY IS TO CLARIFY AMENDED INFORMATION FILED AND AMENDED COUNT 1 IN SENTENCING COURT RECORD OF 06-05-2014.
Telephone contact made with ADA Thomas Potter regarding COUNT 1 Statute 813.125(4) and (7), Wisconsin stats, on Amended Information in this matter due to inability to change Statute in Charges screen.  After careful review of Statutes, COUNT 1 IS AMENDED TO VIOLATION OF INJUNCTION-HARRASSMENT, CONTRARY TO 813.125(7), Wisconsin Stat, an UNKNOWN MISDEMEANOR.  
bmb
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, FILED.
FILED.
FILED.

Defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn in court with attorney Paul A Oberer.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AMENDED INFORMATION, FILED.
COUNT 1 AMENDED to Violation Of Injunction - Harrassment contrary to 813.125(4) and (7), an UNKNOWN MISDEMEANOR.
COUNT 2, AMENDED/ADDED as Disorderly Conduct - PTAC contrary to 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.05, Wisconsin Stats a CLASS B MISDEMEANOR.
  
AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1 and AMENDED/ADDED COUNT 2, Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION. Credit for 6 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 2
Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, CONSECUTIVE to COUNT 1. Credit for 0 days time served. COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years, CONCURRENT to COUNT 1.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION Apply to both counts unless designed otherwise: 
-comply/cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by department of corrections, probation and parole;
-complete 80 hours of community service (COUNT 1);
-no contact with victim, Cassie K. and Co-Defendant, Rebecca Bray;
-pay restitution in the amount of $ZERO;
-pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all applicable fees of supervision; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered
-pay MANDATORY DNA surcharge;  failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-NO POSSESSION OF A FIREARM  FOR 2 YEARS.
-
-  Payment Plan for all monetary obligations to be established by Department of Corrections, Probation and Parole.  All unpaid balances at the end of the probationary period will convert to a civil judgment.
-  Civil Judgment Warning given.
-  Cash Bail Bond posted in this matter in the amount of $2,500.00 on  04-18-2014 is to be applied to all monetary obligations.
  Any bail remaining after payment of all monetary obligations is to be returned to the person who posted.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, FILED.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn in court with attorney Paul A Oberer.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-05-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn in court with attorney Paul A Oberer.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Aaron Frantal.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

14RM020664  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04-16-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant is to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Casie K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Aimee Lynn Schemehorn in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
